title: The popes pedigree: or, The twineing of a wheelband, shewing the rise and first pedigrees of mortals inhabiting beneath the moon. Being a most pleasant and new song. It is a well twined wheelband, the like whereof you never heard, but now shall plainly understand the twineing of the wheelband. To a pleasant new tune, or, London is a brave town.
author: M. P. (Martin Parker), d. 1656?
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed for J. Conyers in Duck-lane [near the Hospital-gate, in West-smithfield,
